title: Center for Wooden Boats
text:
The Center for Wooden Boats (CWB) is a museum dedicated to preserving and documenting the <a href="maritime%20history">maritime history</a> of the Pacific Northwest area of the United States. CWB was founded by Dick Wagner in Seattle in the 1970s and has grown to include three sites; the South <a href="Lake%20Union">Lake Union</a> campus in <a href="Lake%20Union%20Park">Lake Union Park</a>, the Northlake Workshop & Warehouse at the North end of Lake Union, and The Center for Wooden Boats at <a href="Cama%20Beach%20State%20Park">Cama Beach State Park</a> on <a href="Camano%20Island">Camano Island</a>.
Collection.
The CWB collection includes more than 170 vessels, mostly small <a href="sailboat">sailboat</a>s and <a href="rowboat">rowboat</a>s. The boats are divided into a number of sections. The <a href="Boat%20livery">livery</a> fleet includes daysailers, rowboats, and two <a href="pedalo">pedal boats</a>.
The <a href="Blanchard%20Junior%20Knockabout">Blanchard Junior Knockabout</a> is the mainstay of CWB's rental fleet. These boats were designed and built at the Blanchard Boat Company on Lake Union. They have eight, which are used for teaching and rentals.
